contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} '''Otto Witt''' (1875â€“1923) was a [[Sweden|Swedish]] author. He was one of the prominent figures in early Swedish science fiction. He did, among other things, publish [[Hugin (magazine)|Hugin]], a science magazine which was filled "with speculative articles and fiction".<ref name="ma">[[Mike Ashley (writer)|Mike Ashley]], "Science Fiction Magazines:The Crucibles of Change" in David Seed,''A Companion to Science Fiction''. John Wiley & Sons, 2005 ISBN 1405112182 (p. 62).</ref> ''Hugin'' was one of the first [[science fiction magazine|magazines]] to regularly carry science fiction in the world, although it appears to have had little influence outside Sweden.<ref name="ma" /> ==Notes== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=49665921}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Witt, Otto | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swedish writer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1875 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1923 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Witt, Otto}} [[Category:1875 births]] [[Category:1923 deaths]] [[Category:Swedish science fiction writers]] [[Category:Swedish-language writers]] {{Sf-writer-stub}}
